function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Conflict between densification and social distancing measures in urban planning","Impact":"Increased risk of virus spread and public health crises","Mitigation":"Balancing densification with measures that allow for social distancing, such as open spaces and flexible building designs","Technologies":"Smart city technology for crowd monitoring and management","People":"Urban planners, policymakers, and public health officials","Owner":"Urban planning and public health authorities"},{"Description":"Enduring transformation and permanent changes in cities due to COVID-19","Impact":"Disruption of urban environments, social structures, and economic dynamics","Mitigation":"Adapting urban planning and management strategies to accommodate changes in how people live and work","Technologies":"Remote work technologies, smart city infrastructure for healthcare and sanitation","People":"City residents, businesses, and urban development stakeholders","Owner":"City government and urban development agencies"},{"Description":"Restricting access to travel and questing for alternatives to public transit","Impact":"Disruption of transportation systems and mobility patterns, potential economic impact on public transit","Mitigation":"Investing in alternative transportation modes, such as biking, walking, and micro-mobility options, and promoting remote work policies","Technologies":"Smart transportation systems, mobile apps for route planning and social distancing adherence","People":"Commuters, public transit users, and transportation authorities","Owner":"Transportation agencies and local government"}]}
